com.tabuto.j2dgf
Class Group<E extends Sprite>

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          java.util.Vector<E>
              com.tabuto.j2dgf.Group<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<E>, java.util.Collection<E>, java.util.List<E>, java.util.RandomAccess
public class Group<E extends Sprite>
extends java.util.Vector<E>
implements java.io.Serializable

Group is a variable size contiguous indexable array of Sprite. The size of the vector is the number of Sprite it contains. The capacity of the vector is the number of objects it can hold.

Group can be contains every object extends Sprite. Every Group has a Name, and it is possible to Active/Deactive Group, or Active/Deactive single Sprite

Version:
0.7.0
Author:
tabuto83
See Also:
Sprite, Sprite, Serialized Form

Group

public Group(int capacity,
             int capacityIncrement)
Constructs a new Group using the specified capacity and capacity increment.

Parameters:
capacity - the initial capacity of the new vector.
capacityIncrement - the amount to increase the capacity when this vector is full.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if capacity is negative.

Group

public Group(java.util.Vector<? extends E> collection)
Constructs a new instance of Group containing the elements as Sprite or Sprite subclass in collection. The order of the elements in the new Vector is dependent on the iteration order of the seed collection.

Parameters:
collection - the collection of elements to add.

Group

public Group(java.util.Vector<? extends E> collection,
             java.lang.String name)
Constructs a new instance of Group containing the elements as Sprite or Sprite subclass in collection and set the Group name as 'name'. The order of the elements in the new Vector is dependent on the iteration order of the seed collection.

Parameters:
collection - the collection of elements to add.
name - The String contains the name of this Group
